New Records: Mitchell Marsh scored an unbeaten 177 runs for Australia, the highest score in the match.
Steve Smith scored 63 runs and shared a 175-run partnership with Mitchell Marsh.
Australia achieved a win by 8 wickets, their seventh consecutive victory.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh hit a six off Mustafizur Rahman to reach 177 runs, the highest individual score in the match.
Steve Smith played a crucial role in the partnership with Marsh, contributing 63 runs.
Bangladesh's bowlers took key wickets but couldn't contain the Australian chase.
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Pat Cummins expressed confidence in the team's ability to chase down the total.
Mitchell Marsh was praised for his impressive innings and ability to maintain a high tempo.
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Cummins highlighted the importance of the win and the team's momentum heading into the semi-finals.
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged the impact of key run-outs and called for improvement in the middle overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Pune, with Australia winning and moving into the semi-finals with confidence.
